evidence.text: Until the Court determines ‘that final injunctive relief or corresponding declaratory relief is appropriate respecting the class as a whole,’ Fed. R. Civ. P. 23(b)(2), this Order applies only to named Plaintiffs:

extracted.value: Until the Court determines ‘that final injunctive relief or corresponding declaratory relief is appropriate respecting the class as a whole’

evidence.text: (1) The Commissioner is preliminarily enjoined from enforcing Virginia Code § 46.2-395 against Plaintiffs unless or until the Commissioner or another entity provides a hearing regarding license suspension and provides adequate notice thereof;

extracted.value: The Commissioner is preliminarily enjoined from enforcing Virginia Code § 46.2-395 against Plaintiffs unless or until the Commissioner or another entity provides a hearing regarding license suspension and provides adequate notice thereof;

evidence.text: (2) The Commissioner shall remove any current suspensions of the Plaintiffs’ driver’s licenses imposed under Va. Code § 46.2-395;

extracted.value: The Commissioner shall remove any current suspensions of the Plaintiffs’ driver’s licenses imposed under Va. Code § 46.2-395;

evidence.text: (3) The Commissioner is enjoined from charging a fee to reinstate Plaintiffs’ driver’s licenses if there are no other restrictions on their licenses.

extracted.value: The Commissioner is enjoined from charging a fee to reinstate Plaintiffs’ driver’s licenses if there are no other restrictions on their licenses.
